summary: Hermione is mentioned in passing when Mrs. Weasley reads aloud a letter from her, addressed to Harry. Though we don’t hear Hermione’s voice directly, her concern and connection to Harry remain evident through the act of writing. The letter, passed through Ron, reflects her continuing presence in Harry’s life—supportive and involved, even while they are apart. The scene also implies her upcoming visit to the Weasleys, hinting at her re-entry into the active story.
logline: Hermione’s caring presence is felt through a letter, reinforcing her steady connection to Harry.
speech_style: (Implied) Logical and warm; offers reliable updates with a personal touch
